intro: Physaria pueblensis, commonly known as the Pueblo bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with mustard-like flowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, and it is adapted to arid environments. Physaria pueblensis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in desert and semi-desert regions.
